You can't imagine what it's capable of! With its collecting of experiment data, the academic challenge I'm facing will be nailed, blown away.
What does it do?
It looks old-fashioned. Will it really work?
Ji Ting's production isn't vulnerable as you think!
You can't imagine what it's capable of! With its collecting of experiment data, the academic challenge I'm facing will be nailed, blown away.
And your problem. It's simple.
Finally, finally! I can guarantee that this sounds exactly the same as "Yuan"'s!
And it'd be simple for you too: you play this tune, and you will definitely have the Mourning Aix tricked into coming here... and, it will not leave.
We will try right now.
Easy! Easy! I got a question for you.
I just followed some strange sound marks and searched at the 1st research area. I thought it was new materials, but it turned out to be overfrequency traces.
What is all that about? Is there anyone else around?
A Midnight Ranger company was attacked by the Mourning Aix when they were on a mission. This person unfortunately went overfrequent and missing at this area while his teammates were severely injured.
Heavily injured, overclocking
Still someone is hurt.
I'm not Resonators like you, but I've read reports of overclocking, I can imagine the pain.

That fellow is powerful, and reliable.
Good, good! I believe in you Midnight Rangers, just like you who have helped me reproduce "Yuan"'s sounds and completed the experiment.
I ran in a flurry, and only some time after I knew that none of them made it...
W, what?!

I'm so sorry. I'm just a researcher who knows only to bury my head in the research, and whose only thought was to carry forward Ji Ting's research. I didn't even think about helping you to eliminate it earlier...
At least you provided valuable info.
Now we shall put an end to this.
Thank you. That eases my regret, even just a bit...
Thank you... it's you who did this...
Am I saying do much? Don't think about it too much... just go and do what you have to.

Yang Yang, Rover, haven't got your updates. What is the situation now?

Ji Ting researcher? What does he look like?

Mm, copy...

This sound equipment is his gift. It plays "Yuan"'s sounds, which should induce the Mourning Aix to approach.
An induction with the sound of the same kind, taking advantage of their instinctive yearning for similar frequency? Sure, the Mourning Aix is sensitive on that aspect.
But it is still a hard foe. The danger you face could surpass our expectation.
If you couldn't handle, find cover, wait for backup, take no risk.
En, I will take care.
Understood.
This is the place the researcher told us... Rover, let's play "Yuan"'s sounds.
Oh, Yunhe took the Mourning Aix's blow for us. Let's go and his status.
Let's meet Yin Lin!
(Looks to be a tough fight)
No... there is no way back... do you fight like this? Then let's fight!
The voice just not... Was it Yun He who fought here...
The equipment! No, please don't touch it! Oh no...
But, it's really dangerous this time... what if...
Hold it, hold it... champions are bound to face dangers!
Cheer up and get ready to celebrate my triumph...
Its injury...
Is healed!
Mourning Aix's sound marks stop here. It might be covered by molten Tacetite...
The Mourning Aix... What is it longing for? The TD of the past, or the sound that duets with it?
Yunhe, that overclocking Resonator. What happened to him...
We've lost too many things over that hovering Aix... We need to ensure our safty first.
Mourning Aix's sound marks stop here. It might be covered by molten Tacetite...
It worked! Let's move near the core of molten Tacetite, then we can try to destroy it.
It's a... Midnight Ranger weapon! Only under an old standard. Why is it buried together with Mourning Aix's sound marks?
Is it belong to that missing overclocking Resonator?
Should be near..
Tomb of the fallen... that's right where "Yuan" was shot down by the Rangers three years ago.
See? I didn't lie!
You are... unreasonable! Your ears are deaf like stones!
But, what we heard just now was just XXX's cries, wasn't it...
They are sounds I just complied from the sound marks left!
As long as we have this pair of machines by Ji Ting, we can recover any sound that existed.
Sound that existed... Do you mean we recover "Yuan"'s sound to trap the Mourning Aix into coming here?
There are sound marks that the Mourning Aix left here. We should be able to track it if we scan and follow them.
Your guess makes sense. It is very likely he is already mortally wounded.
Overclocking like this should've faint already, and can be easily controlled
No Resontors can be back from overclocking
But your useless worry contributes to nothing but the disturbance of your frequency. You are only inviting my little one's attention.
Yang yang, you do not want to make yourself its potential prey, do you?
It's smart of you, knowing what I am after.
All clear, let's go to next location.
We're in the Fallen Grave area now, but something doesn't feel right... be careful...
Fine, I don't quibble with young people like you.
I found a Ji Ting equipment that can still be activated in an old site in the wild. Right inside a room blocked by molten Tacetite.

This kind of Tacetite is special. Its core can be destroyed by lightning.
Rover, come try it out.
Regarding the weapon we found.
He never stop moving... Interesting
Overclocking and the attack of the Aix.No Resonators can hold on like this.
We will keep on with our respective mission. No messing.
As long as you provide a little trace...
You make a rare kind that dares bargain with me.
Look, what you should know is, merely following its track takes you nowhere.
After the operation that took out "Yuan" three years ago, the Rangers launched a few campaigns against the Mourning Aix, all in vain.
It grew exceptionally cautious, rarely approaching the ground.
Even if a force could be sent in air via gravity stream to close in on it, it runs immediately, risking no chance of human aggressive.
Commander Ji Yan also mentioned this in his brief. Is it really that intractable to deal with...
As for the golems, no matter how bizarre it might look on the surface, it never runs from the thread that controls it.
I received a message a moment ago. The sender was a bit erratic, saying he was a Ji Ting scholar. Nothing worthy of my attention.
You mean...
Nonetheless, his showing here might mean that he is after something.
As for the way to cut its manipulating thread... it is all up to you.
As you said just now, you are a researcher on the field of TD ecology. Could you be so kind to give us some advice and tell us how to trick the Mourning Aix into nearing the ground?
It's a sound catcher of Ji Ting. It makes the one and only pair in this world with another piece of equipment I found.
You already have a solution?
After destroying the Tacetite. Guangjun operated his sound catcher... Sound of TDs came out from another device's location.
Very common.
Very usual.
That's right! You are a smart girl. You should have a career in the academia!

I thought about this. Though the "Yuan", the closest being to the Mourning Aix, has been taken down, we might stand a chance of getting its attention with similar frequencies if we use imitation abilities.
But, wouldn't a senior TD which is able to launch waves of attacks on human be quick to realize the sounds are faked?
No, not faked! Don't you compare Ji Ting's creation with your little terminals with poor data storage and decoding capability!
Sorry, it's our fault to have doubted Ji Ting research results...
What now? Are you ready to start collecting "Yuan"'s sound marks?

Its sound marks left in there? Sounds inconceivable.
Guangjun made his operation...

The sound mark is invalid?

It was then that I heard how the Midnight Rangers put down "Yuan", and their later attempts...

Eh, I haven't told you how I finally got out the tomb in that accident, right?

Before the Mourning Aix found them, I tried to send messages and told them to leave! But there was strong interference, and the message was never sent through.
Not long after, the Mourning Aix attacked them.

This kind of Tacetite is very special, because its core can be destroyed by Wutherium-related Lightning. Shall we try?

In a word, before we start tracking the Mourning Aix, I'd ask both of you to be prepared for anything.
Sounds dangerous.
The monster wave broke out here three years ago. A pair of bird-shaped Tacet Discords with sound waves as their weapon appeared at the same. They were called Yuan and Yang...
The one called "Yuan" was taken out in the Rangers' counteroffensive.
The other that was left kept making lugubrious sounds alone... It was thus given the new name "Mourning Aix".
See that building over there? That was part of Ji'ting, the origin of exploration of Tacetite and TDs.
We're ignorant like a baby towards the Wuthering Wave back then. It was generations of pioneers who shed the light upon us...
Haha, it was all the past! I will carry on with the glory of Ji'ting!
And your research ability.

"Yuan"'s sounds are an extremely rare frequency combination! In the meantime, even in Ji Ting's database, it could be counted as one of the top materials.

TD baits?...
Fallen Grave... It was the location where the Midnight Rangers used to defeat the Aix three years ago.
You're saying the sound mark is still there? Incredible...
This world is full of incredibility...
The road ahead is complicated, are you sure we're in the right direction?
Don't you worry. With my ability of wild survey. I can find it with my closed!
It's ordnance equipment left by Midnight Rangers, used for the Wave of Beast...
You guys put a lot effort into defeating this Aix.
Yes, we were in a dire situation. A warrior risked his life to use the gravity stream to bring it down in the end...
Is it because of the Aix sound mark nearby that you bring us here?
There was one time when I was out in the field and finding myself accidentally in the Fallen Grave.
Suddenly a huge TD appeared before me, and when I could make sense of it, the Mourning Aix was nothing but a few metres from me.
I thought there was no chance I could make it out alive.
But the Aix didn't notice my presence. It just stared at the spot where "Yuan" fell in silence for a long time.
Having seen that, I had an assertion, that there must have been something special in the core of the tomb.
So you think the core of the tomb is "Yuan"'s sound marks?
Exactly, and no other possibility!
The berserk, non-stopping Mourning Aix should have a moment of silence...... indeed there might be something extraordinary in that place.
It's suspucious.
Now you guys trust my judgement!
Alright then, let's keep moving.
It was easy to find the Fallen Grave. But the entrance was cover by Tacetite recently, we need to find another way through.
The Grave is up ahead, we're close!
All thanks to your leading... Can you still hold up?
Of course, I can! [Cough] Ah, been a while since I last exercise.
Just as I expected... The road down below is flooded.
Flooded? Then how should we proceed?
Haha! Don't worry! It's man-made, with the design of Ji'ting. I'm all too familiar with it.
Which means, there should be a machine for water level controlling. Let's find out.
The water level dropped!
You two got quite the efficiency! Would you consider to be my assistance after the mission?
We... Need to think it over.
Tch.. Not any common people could get the invitation from a Ji'ting scholar.
Up ahead! That's the core of Fallen Grave!
That... Must be the pillar with the sound mark!
We need to clear out the Tacetite gather here first!
It's time, set the sound capture device!
Yes! We got it! This is the sound mark of the Aix, materials for crafting TDs Bait!
It's not safe here. We can leave through the gravity stream!
The Mourning Aix hovers high most of the time. It only dives when attacking human; otherwise it hardly lands.
Use your brain! If they are all TDs, why "Yuan" and "Yang"? Why do they always show in pair?
Why when one dies, the other keeps making whines...

It is a fact that the Mourning Aix is crafty, but haven't you given this a thought, that if it can fly up to that height, why doesn't it just leave and get far away, why does it have to stay at this place? It must have a reason!
TDs are drawn towards here! Rover, let's deal with them!
After activating the device, TDs were attracted here...
It attacked the squad near Fallen Grave previously, should be still hovering that area.
I have uploaded the complete frequency to the material database. Should be enough for research.
The mechanism is here!
Oh, Yunhe took the Mourning Aix's blow for us. Let's go and his status.
Let's meet Yin Lin!
We cannot fight the Mourning Aix with the old way. Is "Yuan"'s end the reason it got more cautious?
Any Midnight Rangers near? Come here!
The person who sent this message should... the Ji Ting scholar that Yin Lin just talked about?
Let's find out!
Tacetite here were sealed with sound marks... I should leave it to you guys.
Dim Forest's device? Do you mean that facility sealing the Feilian Beringal?
I can't believe the activation switch is inside a Tacet Field...
All hubs are now activates, the entrance to the Confinement Woods should be open now, we should go check!
Help! Anyone!
When you arrive at the entrance, I will open the access for you.
Fifteen years ago. Academy design a major facility, Forbidden Forest, right in the middle of Dim Forest.
Will it escape by the chance?
Don't worry. The Confinement Woods was made with Resonators' power amplified by special equipment. It is rather strong.
Besides, the only way out is through the top. It is too narrow for Feilian Beringal to escape with its large body.
Even if the beast was intractable to be kept alive, we shouldn't have paid such great cost.
The battle was fought many years ago, there isn't much in the records, it only mentions lack of combat capabilities.
Was it flaw in the operation plan?
It was... A battle rarely mentioned even within the Rangers.
Signs of the Crownless's resurrection is rather apparent, the task of absorbing Threnodian powers must be done swiftly. I fear that you'll have to improvise your tactics along the way.
Especially you, Rover.
Your special abilities have not been fully studied yet, don't go too ahead of yourself, safety comes first.
Look, the portrait on the sign over there. It's all blurry, could it have survived the Lament?
Rover, Dim Forest was formerly a wildlife park, a place filled with joy.
Look, the portrait on the sign over there. It's all blurry, could it have survived the Lament?
I heard that after returning from the battle with the Beringal, one of the Rangers opened a tea house in Tiancheng.
He is a well-distinguished hero and I have always wanted to pay him a visit.
Yet I worry if it'll remind him of that horrible experience...
These building, judging from the degree of weathering, they must be an aftermath of the Lament... Does this have anything to do with the "wildlife park"?
Hmm, I wonder what this cage is meant for, and where these lights are coming from...
This place give me an uncomfortable feeling, be on the lookout.
People with similar clothes have been showing up a lot lately, it seems they are from the same group.
This key... The Beringal must've carried it around its neck all this time.
I wonder what it's for. Rover, shall we keep it somewhere safe for now?
The vines here still have the ability to grow, so they may be able to form new pathways!
These canisters... Containers for Wutherium Transimitters, the team before us must've left them here in a hurry...
Oh, it's a type of medicine that can be used to stimulate Resonators' neural growth and even enhance psychic abilities for a short time.
The Drive Hub is locked inside of the cage...
Judging from the construction, the surrounding installations seem to have something to do with the cage.
Oh, no! The cage door shut itself right as the Drive Hub was activated!
The Hoochiefs are trying to provoke us. Are they looking for a fight, or is there something else to this...
If we didn't experience it ourselves, it would be really hard to believe what we just saw.
The Hoofchieves scattered out once the cage is open.
They dropped the key. We can try it on the tree cage.
These behaviors, its surpassed the level that of any MO possesses.
Are they becoming more aggressive or intelligent because of the Threnodian power's influence?
Base on the monitor report in recent year, it has merged with its surrounding environment. No one ever think of reopen it.
Oddly... as special Ranger squads, they should be capable of falling back unharmed if there was emergency.
Archive shows that the Rangers had a battle with Feilian Beringal. We lost a few special squads.
When things go wrong, RUN.
Don't worry, I'll be looking out for you.
I understand your meaning.
What if... We might be able to use this to get a plant to grow? Hmmm, might as well try it!
Thank you, it smelled really bad in there...
We were originally here to recover unused Wutheride Transmitters, didn't expect to run into this...
Thank you! Thank you!
Didn't expect to run into something like this... It'll sure become quite a story back in the regiment!
Here I was thinking how long are we going to be locked up in here...
This territory belongs to those monsters, I really don't know how many other traps they have placed around the forest.
Thank you, we were watching out for those Hoochiefs carefully enough, didn't expect to fall into any traps...
Looks like we need to investigate the Dim Forest even more form now on... Be careful when you're conducting any operations in this area!
There's a strange group of people here, I wonder what they're up to...
Look at all these Coriolus! They're written inside the Ranger's handbook, an edible fungus.
Seniors saw those Hoofchieves eaten those mushrooms, and then try them out to make sure the mushrooms are not toxic.
Be careful when collecting mushrooms, don't touch any that you don't know!
The road is collapsing, watch out!
There are signs of Hoochief activities on the ground... Judging from these footprints, they're not very large in size, likely still underage.
Look! A Drive Hub! There are traps around it, so be careful, it's best not to approach directly.
Wait! It'll cause too much noise, plus who knows what else they might've booby trapped.
I already paid a price for my carelessness.
Aren't you being a bit too cautious?
Hold on, a strange Hoochief came by earlier and stuffed me this thing, it looks like a map!
Have a look, see if there are any clues for opening this cell.
There are others locked up in different places as well, we're counting on you!
There's a unique marking on the map, could it be what we're looking for?
Thank you... It's all thanks to you...
But there's so many of them, how in the world are we gonna do that...
No need to panic, for now, you should sort out your gear and withdraw from the area.
Yes, you're right! We should report back to the Regiment.
We'll be heading back now, be careful.
What are the Hoochiefs trying to gain by treating the Rangers like this...
It sure a complex way of doing things if they're just trying to have fun out of this.
The Feilian Beringal!
Imprisoning people. They behave like...
Are you saying that they're locking up anyone wearing Ranger uniforms, just because the Rangers did the same to the Beringal in the past?
It is a possibility.
Bailian did mention before, that the Hoochiefs caused the Rangers a lot of trouble during the Beringal's capture
If this is of no coincidence, then the Hoochiefs are trying to protect the Beringal with their lives.
If that's the case, then everything makes sense now.
The Hoochiefs were trying to threaten us from entering the forest by targeting Rangers.
One of the Rangers mentioned being forced to fight each other with sticks...
More uncertainties are beginning to arise.
None of these behaviors have been observed prior. It must've occurred recently.
Dim Forest is quietly undergoing some kind of change... There must be more dangers lying hidden where we happened noticed.
Was the Hoochiefs trying to use this to trap us in?
There should be a way to open the cage from the inside, let's get out of here first...
The Acoustic Meters are working again, let's wait for Bailian to activate the device.
No movement from the Beringal, strange...
Are you nervous?
There's something I need to check with the Commander.
Yangyang? Did you encounter some difficulties?
We still have time.
Commander, time is short, forgive me for speaking bluntly.
Fifteen years ago, the loses the Rangers suffered... Was it not because of lack in combat capabilities, but rather another reason behind it?
The Beringal was ultimately chosen to be locked up instead of being eliminated, does it have something to do with the forest... Or perhaps, the Hoochiefs?
Details of that incident was never made public, since you chose to ask at such a time, it would be discourteous of me to attempt to avoid it.
Your speculations are mostly correct.
As these MOs were causing quite some disturbances, the Rangers initially did indeed plan to put it end to them once and for all.

Yet, after Choral Command and the Academy conducted a thorough analysis of the large quantity of data gathered from the frontline, they came to the conclusion that the Feilian Beringal is closely connected to the local Hoochief population.
One could also argue that they formed a relation of rule.

If the Beringal is to be exterminated, without a leader, in its wake a new wave of internal conflict and migration will occur among the Hoochief population, which will evidently spread an affect throughout the forest.
Not to mention the Rangers were already had their hands tide in dealing with the "TD Wave" going on at the time.
Therefore, in the end, it was decided that elite units were to be dispatched and contain the Beringal, make use of its relation with the Hoochiefs, to control them within the forest.
Result wise, we achieved our initial goals, but the price we paid for it... Was indeed a severe tragedy.
They did consume too much energy in order to generate the Confinement Woods?
That is more to it.
When the amount of energy required far exceeded calculations, the Command immediately ordered a full retreat.
Due to the powers the Beringal bear, the Rangers of the time worried that they wouldn't get a second chance in capturing it, thus...
However, the good thing is that this time you don't have to worry about it.
I've already informed the entire regiment to enter a state of combat readiness, in an event of a possible Hoochief disturbance.
Wait? The entire population... There's so many of them we could barely count!
Something I also do not wish to see.
Maybe that's not entirely the case...
A signal, your suggestion surprises me. What type of signal do you hope to send out during the battle with the Beringal?
Precisely, we go in, finish the task and get out immediately afterwards, and try our best not to provoke the Hoochiefs. I think is the best way of action.
I'll only take its powers, it can live for now.
The risks are too high, it may even trigger a stronger retaliation from the Beringal.
If you should fail, we will pursue with the original operation as planed.
Well, then, Rover...
I will have Rangers outside the forest's perimeter on standby per usual, you do not need to worry.
I promise we'll return safely, together with Yangyang.
Through the enduring night, we shall return victorious!
Rover, remember to keep your promise.
Rover, Dim Forest was formerly a wildlife park, a place filled with joy.
Here is a notice board, the things written on it have been blurred, but some words can be vaguely seen...
Its gesture looks familiar, could it be... Trying to imitate a Ranger's salute?
That Hoochief was behaving really strangely... They usually act in groups, rarely in singles.
Watch out, we're surrounded by Hoochiefs!
The slots on these devices seems to be used for housing modules, we should give it a try!
There they are. The key should be on those Hoofchieves!
The cage door is open!
Careful! They're coming towards us.
All four Hubs are activated, this should do the trick, right?
Maybe there is some way... To deactivate the traps?
It came out of nowhere, and started making these strange gestures, what could this mean?
Ook-ook...
I don't understand that.
It is indeed difficult to understand, but it seems to contain some... Complex emotions.
The Drive Hub is not far up ahead... It seems to be a huge cage there, is it trying to stop us from getting closer?
Tooky-tooky!
It's getting anxious all of a sudden...
Does it... Have something to do with us trying to set the Beringal free?

When you arrived, the Hoochief suddenly rushes onto the road, blocking your path. Just as you are about to attack it, the Hoochief moves its palm in front of its throat, behaving strangely without any intentions to fight.
Upon hearing you mention the Feilian Beringal, the Hoochief seemed to have a great change of mood and ran away in a hurry...
Hmm? That Hoochief seems like the one we encountered earlier, did it follow us all this way?
Hoochief disturbance...
How large do you anticipate it'll be?
According to the Academy's speculation, almost the entire Hoochief population... They will occupy the entire Dim Forest, and the battle will even spread to other areas.
Yet, the Hoochiefs will act upon the Beringal's death, it is inevitable.
Not all Hoochiefs are hostile towards humans.
Plus, the forest is filled with edible fungus, which proves that the carrying capacity of the forest is still abundant and can fully support their continued reproduction.
For them, it is better to remain in this forest than to enter to the outside world, which is full of danger and uncertainty.
Yangyang is telling the truth.
I believe that if we send out a signal of some sort, the potential of a disturbance can be quelled.
… Yangyang, I recognize that tone of voice of yours anywhere.
I'm aware that any decisions from me would fail to persuade you otherwise.
Blue glowing plants... Don't see these very often. I have learned of them in the Huanglong ecological archives, a new species that evolved after the Lament.
What's wrong? There was a some noise just now, are you about to engage the Beringal?
No, the sound came from deep within the forest.
The Beringal on the other hand... Is actually still calm in its cage.
Bailian, the passageway in front of us did not open, did something go wrong?
There may be many factors involved, but practically speaking, it is most likely that a Drive Hub might have failed.
A Drive Hub? What's that...?
The Acoustic Meters are connected to the energy network via the transmission & transformation unit, and the port that controls the transmission and transformation unit is the Drive Hub.
Well, practically speaking, your understanding is correct from that point of view.
So it's an On/Off switch for the Acoustic Meter?
What should we do next?
There are a total of four Drive Hubs, distributed in the four corners of the Dim Forest, and all of them need to be activated.
Considering the Hoolock vexo population within the forest, the process will not be easy.
Hoolock vexo... The name sounds familiar.
You can also call them Hoochiefs.
A single Hoolock vexo is easy to deal with, but they usually act in troops and are very cunning.
That strange noise in the forest just now is most likely caused by them.
The Hoolocks also caused us quite some trouble during the capture of the Beringal in the past.
MOs acting in groups, could they have sensed us entering the forest... Understood, Rover and I will keep our guards up.
The Academy has been continuously monitoring the behavior of the Hoolock vexos over the years and has come up with some statistical conclusions that should be of some help to you in your operation.
But the data is ultimately just for references only, expect that they will have unexpected behaviors.
In short, you have to deal with more than just the Beringal, so you must be careful.
They're Rangers! How could... Why are they all locked up?
*Cough... *Cough... It was a trap! We're part of the 90th Company, we walked right into those Hoochiefs' trap! They've set booby traps all over the forest!
They beat us up, took our terminals, and locked us in here!
What are they trying to achieve in doing this?
There's nothing in the records... It must be a new behavior pattern of MOs.
Darn those wretched beasts! How are we supposed to conduct any missions with them crawling all over the place!
We should report back to the Commander and reevaluate the Wutheride Transmitter retrieval plan immediately!
Hey, can't you let us out first?
I'll cut open the cell gate right away!
Drive Hub's just up ahead.
Rover, Let's pick up the pace!
Bailian, we've reached the Confinement Woods' entrance.
Then you should be able to see a barrier made of vines, and the Acoustic Meters.
That's the special device that can control the growth of vines with melodic changes.
Please step back a little, I'm going to activate it and open up a passageway for you.

As soon as Bailian's words fell, the lamp post in the center of the Acoustic Meter flickered a few times, then quickly went out. Except for a few rustling sounds coming from the depths of the Dim Forest, nothing seems to have changed.
"Conservation Zone", I wonder what that's supposed to mean?
Huh? What a strange Hoochief... Let's get on with our mission.
What happened back there was really strange. Don't let your guard down.
Strange. They didn't attack us and leave immediately.

Hoochief above the tree dropped some kind of unknown object and sabotaged the traps in front of you. Then it noticed Yangyang and you. They hop together then turn around, and back to the deeper forest.
The road is sabotaged, it seems the terrain around here changed...
Are these... cages on the ground? Why they're here?
Look at all these Coriolus! They're written inside the Ranger's handbook, an edible fungus.
Look above from here... The Dim Forest seems extremely quiet.
We did it! We can continue exploring ahead.
The area is clear, no more sights of Hoochief attacking.
We stopped the riot.
Hoochief can be easily read. Showing teeth means angry, hopping means happy.
The big one is a bit hard to read. But it still don't know how to disguise itself and knows only to protect its kin.
They're much simpler then most of the people.
Thank you for trusting our judgement, to let Feilian Beringal finish it all.
Guess I can make out a fine report after I get back.
Huh, so you guys don't need to handle this kind of paper work.
The mission is not yet over. We still have one last target for the absorption, Mourning Aix. Midnight Rangers have yet to find the solution about it.
Rover, we just have a good fight, and you need rest.
There's a supply station in Whining Aix's Mire. We can get there first to do some investigation and make preparation at the same time.
One TD down, another to go...
So even the Midnight Rangers commander need the power of an outsider now?
He and I are both outsiders.
I expect next mission to can be special, don't patronize me again with this kind of trash.
If that's what you want... We Midnight Rangers will try our best to suit your need.
So long.
Midnight Rangers, is that the home "you" crave for?
When Rangers in the past first came here to explore, they saw Hoochiefs feeding on it, later they gave it a taste and finally determined that it was not poisonous.
Be careful when collecting mushrooms, don't touch any that you don't know!
Look, did they just use Bursting Crystals to destroy the traps?
Rover, let's keep moving and pay more attention to their movements.
We can pass through that rock, should be there soon!
So many of them... I wonder there'll be more ahead...
Let's just take it out.
Ook-ook...
Wait, it seems to understand us.
There... This Hub has been successfully activated!
You hope to not take its life?
Those bastards, they gave us these sticks, and forced us to fight each other... I'll have them exterminated sooner or later!
Thank you, thank you for your help... I feel a bit better, now that I'm further away from the fog.
Is this the fog they mentioned?
You're, you're back again... Don't tell me you're planning to go in there again.
Woah! It must've taken the Rangers quite some work to move that rock, now its blown to pieces just like that.
The fog's density inside the tunnel is greater than expected, we may not make it till the end even with these gear.
More of those "Caccoons", let's get rid of them fast!
Excuse me, we'd like to see the Mornguard in charge, please?
Ah... Be good, mommy's going to work. I promise you will be back tonight. Goodbye.
Sorry, a bit of personal business, I am the head of this part of the industrial area, Rongqiu. You must be... Yangyang from the Rangers? Then the one next to you must be the Rover.
We would like to inquire about the Hazy Depths.
I just heard you talking to your daughter, is there some emergency at home? Are we disturbing you?

Not at all, it's something related to the recent anomalies at the mines. Fog is spreading in the mining area somehow, so us Mornguards are on overtime patrol. I haven't been home for several days, and my daughter's just misses me alot.

Well... Who wants to be away from home all the time? Kids these days, they grow up so fast! I can't wait to put her in my arms and take her with me everywhere I go! But we have more important responsibilities to attend to.
Hello.
It's been a tough time for everyone.

At first a few miners said they heard voices of their loved ones, we all thought they were homesick, and the foreman was even ready to grant them a few days of leave, in the end... They just suddenly disappeared.
Not only did we not find them, but more people started hearing these voices.
In our call, my daughter just told me that she's hearing voices of her grandfather as well... To be honest, I'm getting a little scared too.
Are there any other anomalies besides the spreading of fog?
Voices... Why does the fog bring voices?
We all think that there is something in the Hazy Depths that is luring everyone inside... But it's completely so we can't go in and investigate.
That's all I know, sorry I can't provide you with more information.
If the fog's the only thing causing all these anomalies, the Hazy Depths must be a very dangerous place, are you sure you want to go there?
It's much more reassuring now that it has caught the attention of the Rangers. If you move quick, you might still be able to catch up with the Ranger that came earlier.
Did the Commander dispatch another Ranger? We were not informed of this...
It's a girl with a fresh face, she came for the voices from the fogs as well.
It must be dealt with before more harm is done.
The family members of those gone missing are starting to hear voices, with these chain of events, then the Hazy Depths' danger levels will be raised once more.
Information coming out of the mines were also limited in the past, which makes things even more strange.
Rover, let's continue with our investigation.
Doesn't seem like anything special.
Don't touch it! You're always trying to get yourself into trouble, don't make us get worried about you all the time. Remember the same thing happened with the Crownless last time, right?
Sorry.
I don't mean to blame you, it's just that the fog is still dangerous... We still haven't finished analyzing what it's made of yet, and it may cause you start hearing voices just like them.
Use your terminal to scan the fog, collect enough samples for Commander Jiyan.
No need to worry, we came prepared this time, with these professionally made protective gear.
We'll put an end to this once in for all.
*Sigh... Why won't you listen?
Forget it... If you insist on going, the entrance to the tunnel is on this side, you can get in by blowing up the large rock the Rangers used to seal it up.
I wish you all the best. I'll be here keeping guard as usual.
Uhh... These voices are so chaotic, it feels like there's so many people talking all at once...
Rover, the fog seems to be coming out from that cocoon like object.
Destroying that "cocoon" might lower the density, let's give a try.
Another cocoon, it seems they're quite prevalent within the tunnel. Could it have connections with the "oddities" within the fog?
It's not the one calling out to Danjin... The "voices" is still somewhere deeper.
It's good to see that you're ok. Rest assured, we're here to solve the problem, we won't let anyone be in danger anymore.
Don't tell me you're going in there?! No! Entry of the cavern is officially prohibited. As Mornguard, I, Tangqi, will not allow you to risk your lives.
No, you have no idea... Of how horrifying it is...
The warriors of the Midnight Rangers will not be frightened it the face of danger. Your information will surely be of help in completing of this mission. Can you please share with us?
I... Alright, alright... If it can help you in any way, I'll tell you everything I know...

It was right when I was sent to be stationed at the tunnel's entrance, the last research team that was just about to head into the Depths. There were twenty-seven of them, but only one made it back...
In the end, I saw the fog pouring out of the tunnel, swallowing everything in its path like it was alive, the signs, the tunnel lights...
Even, swallowing him...
We were sent under the orders of Commander Jiyan.
The last one that made it out?
Yes... Yanshu. He managed to make it out of the cavern, but the fog wouldn't let him go...

I can still remember, we were so glad he made it out, his master patted his shoulders and told him to go home to see his daughter, but he collapsed without a warning... And his body temperature just went stone-cold...
And he started saying things, his voice low and confused, he said... He said...
His team is still in the tunnel, calling him to go back... I'm certain he's not talking crazy!
I... I think I'm beginning to hear it too...
Sorry... I was too scared. When that expedition ended in failure, the top sent people to seal the entrance and stop the spread of the fog. I thought the nightmare was over.
You see all those fogs? We've never seen so much of it, ever since we sealed off the tunnel! I guess it's coming to "explore" us now.
Calm down.
I really do not want you to step into that place, that tragedy, I don't want to witness it a second time...
We appreciate your concerns, but please trust us!
Hello there, can you please introduce us to the mine?
No problem! We are now standing on the uppermost level of the Hukou Mine, which is mainly used as a transportation hub, connecting Tiancheng to the port.
The mid-levels has a dispatch center that oversees the operations of the entire mine, and anything related to our staff can pretty much be solved there.
Further down is the mining area, where our main operations are located. The deepest part of the mine, and the entrance to the Hazy Depths, but people are usually not allowed to go in.
Thank you, we now have a general idea of the mining site. Let's go to these levels respectively for our investigation later on.
Rover, can you spare a moment? I have something to discuss with you.
Correct
Is it about Danjin?

Your findings of the exploration team, the entire team perished in the Hazy Depths, Danjin's father, Yanshu, was among them. He is my old comrade, we carried through the Battle of Gorges of Spirits, but...

He led a team into the Depths with his wounds from Gorges of Spirits not fully healed. I should have, together with the investigation, just from then on, I would bear myself with stronger responsibilities.
Since his passing, I promised to help take care of then young Danjin.
I... I never imagined something like this happened.
This was before you joined the Rangers. Danjin is also unaware of this.
Danjin... Had an incident. She suffered traumatic brain injury, causing her to lose all of her memory.
Considering her father's connection to the Hazy Depths, I am worried that continuing to let her investigate would not cause her more harm.
Is it bad to have her memories back?
The happiness she has now is based on what she has forgotten. I can't guarantee that she will be as happy as she is today when she remembers everything
To forget also holds its share of pain.
As I was entrusted with the task of protecting her, I should very least ensure her current safety.
Rover, Can you take care of Danjin on this mission?
But Danjin already made her choice.
Rover, it's rare to for Danjin to met someone as understanding as you are. May I entrust her to your care during this task?
It's... A backpack belonging to the research team? Could its owner been devoured by the mist?
Look, Yangyang, a Ranger's badge, they used to be Rangers too. If they managed to leave here, they would've become my family too, right?
But instead they...
Danjin...
Danjin's fine, lets look further, there must be more clues left by the research team.
You're right, there's leftover data. Could these be their research notes?
And a Ranger service number, "Jiaxin, N1111620592".
"... There are fewer and fewer of us, and at the last turn we've lost Yinhan and Chi'su. It was so quiet around us that none of us spoke, and we could only hear the voices in the fog.
"The white fog enshrouds us, and we all suspected that it was some kind of life form, surviving uniquely underground, but there was no way to verify it.
"We put our hopes on Yanshu, the resources, the data, the hope to live... Hoping that he can go out and bring back the information that we risked our lives to investigate.
"Little petal, mommy cannot keep her promise... The mist is devouring me... I... miss you..."
Yanshu, did he make it out alive?
Wonderful, he must have been reunited with his family.
Well, then, it is up to Danjin now to bring the rest of everyone home.
He did, he made it out of the tunnel.
Danjin, are you alright? What happened...
It's the voice that's been calling out to me... It's feels so familiar... But Danjin just can't remember...
Why do I... Feel so sad?
We've completed our task, and I even helped out. I should feel happy.
But... But deep down in my heart, I feel like there's a huge hole left inside. Something I never should've forgotten! *Sob...
They, they've left Danjin forever, did they...
Look... A pack of Dreadmanes are attacking a Tacetite transport? Strange, they don't usually come onto the roads...
Rookie! Pass me a Type 7 screwdriver, will ya? This here drill shaft's mechanical arm's badly worn, and the screws' done broken inside, I need to find a way to pry 'em outta there.
Gotta be that little brat Zu again, rough drivin' the haul truck. I ain't gonna go easy on 'im this time!
It looks like this engineer chief's got his hands full, let's help him bring over what he needs.
You've got me there... But there may be repair boxes left by others near the security checkpoint, we can look for one there.
You've got the wrong person...
What does a "Type 7 screwdriver" look like?
An all-purpose toolbox? You take your master for a fool?!
Hey, you look mighty suspicious, don't you now? Who here gave you permission inside the mining site. Aren't you Ranger girl shoulda stop these suspicious folks from comin' in here?
We are here to investigate the Hazy Depths. The Rangers received reports of personnel going missing recently. Do you know anything?
It's that "Strange Voices" thing again?
Do you hear them as well?
I ain't gone mad, of course I can't hear it.
Do you mean to say that the voices are not caused by the fog, but rather by the people themselves?
Ya every heard of "Three men make a tiger"? These fogs' been around here before the mining site even came to be, ya think it's gonna wait all this long to start making people go funny?
How did the fog appear?

'Twas the Threnodian War, the mythical beast Sui'guang fought the Threnodian for three days straight, day 'n night, not even a smidge of light can be seen. With a loud "Bang!" And there it was, a large hole was left as an aftermath of their battle.
It is said that since then, the bottom of the hole has been shrouded in fog for years. Some nosey folks gave it the name "Hazy Depths", making up some story that there are monsters deep inside.

After Huanglong discovered Tacetite veins in the place, they built this Hukou Mine, everything was fine even been right next to the fog and all... No one in their right minds would go pokin' around that thing for no reason.
So nothing ever happened?

Well, the only thing that happened was 'bout twenty some years ago during the "TD Wave", probably with the war and the mining goin' on at the same time, caused a shift in the rocks structure, and tore a tunnel leading straight to the depths of the fog.
Dunno what happened after that, since they had the Rangers seal it tight, and put Mornguards keepin' an eye on it. No one's allowed in.
That granddaughter of mine told me a few "insider news" before, things like bodies of past expedition teams inside, strange echoes, and all. A bunch of nonsense.
We appreciate you for telling us all of this.
No!
Those who got close to the fog all ended up getting screwed! I won't, I won't listen to your tricks...
Stop calling my name...
I've transferred the fog's data to Commander Jiyan. We should contact him.
How... Why can't I get a connection? The data transfer was working just fine.
I do recall hearing about the problems with signal down in the mines, let's go back to the upper levels.
I've received your data from the samples, we're having experts analyze it as we speak, there should be some results available soon.
Huh, right away? Did you forget you just force me another research of the device, or you have higher expectation of me?
I conducted a quick comparison with your data to the one from five years ago, there are two values which requires attention, which are... Never mind, I'll cut to the chase.

You just have to remember, inhaling this fog will disrupt your central nervous system, causing hallucinations. As the temperature of the fog is significantly low, any unprotected contact and you'll be in for an amputation levels of frostbite.
An amputation, that's at least a Stage 4 frostbite, it seems we need to issue another warning to the miners to avoid the fog.
Our biggest problem now is that we still do not have an intelligence system set up yet, methods of repelling the fog and its origins are still unknown.

Lack of intelligence can be a major setback on the battlefield. Yet, this is a matter which concerns the Tacetite industry, there's no time for hesitation. It's time that we launch an offensive into the caverns, even under current conditions.

Already one step ahead of you. The Academy's research on the fog has always been running around the clock, plus, with the pre-research of the Incineranur protective gear, all I have to do is to load in these new sample data, make a few tunes, and we're good to go.
Don't forget to have someone come pick 'em up in the afternoon.
Very well, a man worthy of his name as Chief Researcher at the Academy, I will come retrieve them in a moment..
Don't tell me you'll be leading the operation?
The risks of this matter has gone beyond any previous predictions. And, as you already know, I've always preferred to take matters in hand.
With the current incident with the Hukou being of utmost importance, a boost in morale is needed, and I am the most suitable candidate.
As for the resurrection of the Threnodian, I don't think it'll take me to remind you that, for the "King" to move middlegame, are you sure you've made up your mind about your next move?
I already have a team in mind.
Commander, request permission to take part in this operation!
Danjin?
I don't want to remain a fledgling who is not capable and has to be sheltered!
No matter what difficulties I encounter and how much I am wounded, I hope to fight as a true warrior, just like everyone in the night!
When your wings are full, you can naturally fly high, but not yet.
If I let it go, it feels like Danjin will miss something very, very important...
"Through the enduring night. May you all return victorious."
I believe that Danjin must feel the same, her persistence at this very moment, shows that she is ready to step into the long night.
Rover, Yangyang.
Through the long night... Is it now?

Night return to the fifth mobile support team, Danjin, now officially to support the Rover this task to you, immediately depart to the Misty Pit, to find out the cause of the mutation, to protect teammates and themselves.
Dajin, order received!
I was on my way to bring the device there. I'm having another song creating, don't have any time to waste on the road.
Yessir! Dangjin is on her way! Rover, Yangyang, let's meet at the entrance of the Hukou Mines later!
Rover, I brought the gear, here, lemme share it with you and Yangyang.
Thank you for helping Danjin to convince the Commander. If it was just me, he would not have agreed to my participation. But the closer I get to this place, the more certain I am that I must come!
Let's go.
If you feel uncomfortable, tell me right away, okay?
The surrounding fog seems to have dissipated a bit.
Danjin...
Something fell out of the cocoon?
Quick, Danjin can feel it now, we're getting closer to the voices!
This cavern, caused by a single blow from the Threnodian...
Data of each member of the research team has been recorded into my terminal. They are now all accounted for...
Did I succeed in bringing them home?
Yes, you did.
At last, they can be with their loved ones again...
That hug in the end... It felt cold yet so warm. As if I was cuddled again by those I love... A feeling I missed so much...
Danjin, the Rangers will always be your home.
Of course! Commander Jiyan, Yangyang, everyone at the Rangers, and even Rover... Everyone is my family!
Oh, I almost forgot, we should report our investigations to the Commander.
Danjin, splendid work as well.
Tee-hee, it's all thanks to Rover and Yangyang, I'll do even better next time!
Did you learn anything about the voices?
Hmm... The voices... They were a bit different from what I expected, so much about them that I don't understand, but, that's good enough for now.
You learned a lot in this mission.
Rover, thank you for taking care of Danjin, and your hard work.
Hurry, we must stop them before they damage the transport's Melody Capsules.
An all-purpose toolbox, it should have a "Type 7 screwdriver" inside...
I've never seen professional repair tools like these, so I can't be sure. Anyway, let's just take the entire box back to the engineer.
The Mornguards are in trouble. Rover, we should assist, quick.
Crises don't wait gently for people to grow up.
I knew it was no small thing, but there was no way Dangan could give up the moment. That voice that called me, it must have something it wanted to convey to Dangan, and I wanted to go investigate it.
No fooling around.
I will also bring everyone return victorious.
I will keep Danjin safe. You have my word.
You have my gratitude.
You mean she'll do her best to find the source of the voices... I did not expect her to be so insistent on the matter, perhaps in the dark, she really felt something.
We made this declaration when we joined the Midnight Rangers, and in mission after mission, each Night Return soldier has come to appreciate the meaning of this statement more deeply.
Got it.
Let's go already, Danjin can't wait longer. Those voices are making my ears and heart rumble just by standing here.
Who could it be, always, always, always calling out to Danjin...
Hmm? I have a feeling I've seen you before...
Because of the voices, I want to find its source, once we know who "it" is, Danjin and everyone will no longer be disturbed by it anymore.
Have you met with Danjin before?
No, maybe I'm just hallucinating...
Now we can go into the caverns. I'm getting a bit nervous, breathe in... breathe out... Ok, let's go!
We should look for the fog's origin first, see if we can stop its spread.
Did someone just call Danjin's name? What a strange feeling...
Let's break it and continue further inside.
We should give it a look, see if there are any clues.
We can use our terminals to search for some data.
Danjin...
A job well done, Rover, Yangyang.

Dajin, the girl who we just met, is the Rangers' little sister. Well... She's not a family member of anyone's, she's currently under the Rangers care along with the other children who have lost their families.

Danjin's usually pretty shy around strangers, but she's a good girl. It's a first time seeing her being so stubborn on something. For someone who she's never met before, it's also strange for her to get so close to you...
Also, her ability, is acting... In a bit strange way. She's different from her usual self. Didn't scare you, did she?
I've been... waiting... for you, always waiting...
That voice... Is it from those people lost in the fog? Why does feel to familiar to Danjin, I can't help but want to get close to it...
No, it's the TDs mimicking their voices... How dare they desecrate the fallen in such way. This is unforgivable!
We've arrived at the "Heart of Huanglong", Hukou Mines. By transforming the Tacetite's frequencies into "Heartbeat", we deliver the energy everywhere, setting the world in motion.

A rather impressive spectacle, right? But if you look closely, this place is actually made up of individual units. It took several generations of the people of Huanglong's wisdom in order to be combined into a functioning whole.
As for the conditions of the mine, let's ask a mine staff, they must know the place best.
Rover, the mist in the mine can react to human. We need more clues to find out the truth.
For everyone's convenience, we built this giant elevator. Spectacular isn't it.
We should use the elevator to other floor.
You can activate the elevator here, and reach to the next floor.
I'm so flattered to be trusted by the big leader.
I believe you are.
With the power absorbed. The fog dissipated, and the Wutheron level is dropping.
Guess I worried too much. You have the power to absorb the Threnodian, and you used it well.
Thank you, I know what I'm capable of.
It's my pleasure.
For the next mission. I hope you and Yangyang can go to Forsaken Abundance, retrieve the Protection Device from the Morn Guard there.
For Incinero Petal?
Yes. Inferno Rider resurrected there. The flowers are toxic, while they stop the Rider from leaving, they also stop us from getting in.
Retrieval permission has been sent to your terminal, take care.
You came to the Knell Squre.\nYangyang recorded the names of the exploration team members in the data center, while Danjin whispered their names one by one... It's her only way to say goodbye.
We're almost in the Industrial Area.
Let's go to the Industrial Area first, then we can get to Hukou mine through Rock Circle Road. It's more convenient that way, and we can check on the mist situation on our way there.
Come here, I can take you to a short cut.
Morn Guard on patrol in the mine and Industrial Area should be near, we can go ask her about some details.
Remember the sensor modules back in the campsites? These devices are of similar model, all belong to the Threnodian War era.
I make contacts with the campsite regularly, never been like this before.
Especially the one in Sector 1, can't get a signal from them. Not normal, can you go check it out?
Right away.
The security system is controlled by an electrical circuit, in case of an emergency the power will be shut off directly.
Look for the induction modules around the area, and power should resume power once you reinstalled it.
Captain Awu would like to be alone, we should leave him be.
Military base is not open for regular people.
These TDs triggered the security system, some doors are already shut.
These devices are designed to cut power in event of an emergency, to turn it on... See that module over there? That's the power unit, try using Levitation to restore them.
There, got it, the effect of a single module is limited, it's best that we have both parts of the device before going into the Incineranur.
Managed to get both modules? If not, it's easy to get hurt when you enter the Incineranur.
I just received a communication from the Ministry.
The Fission Cannon, which was scheduled to be fully repaired by today, could not be completed due to various reasons.
We need to rely on the Fission Cannon to break through the high intensity barrier covering the Inferno Rider. It's a layer of defense structure that it generated by itself.
Captain Awu, though young in age, but a very capable fighter, most Resonators in Tiancheng are no match for him.
You mean his ears? They're cute, aren't they?
But, he'd suffered a fair share of criticisms in the past because of his looks. In the past, Huanglong rarely had Resonators who looked so... Different.
Later, Captain Awu proved capabilities in battles and is now a hero in everyone's hearts.
The temperature is too high in here, look, the heat is even causing light to refract.
Hmm? You think... It's pretty? But pretty things are always dangerous.
After the Lament, people are afraid to trust anything that looks beautiful in the wilderness.
Take Gurglepuffs for example. They may look cute, but on the contrary they're a pain to deal with. If you ever see one in a craters or waterholes around this area, it's best that you avoid them.
These are barricades and Wutherium Radiation Emitters left here after the Threnodian war, equipments vastly used for positional defenses back in the day.
All there's left now are their wreckage.
But the true wall of steel is the will of the people of Huanglong to resist, and it has not, and will not collapse.
After everyone moved to Tiancheg, they renamed this place to "Forsaken Home", likely to commemorate the lost homeland.
During the annual Knell Day, the Rangers organizes residents to attend commemorative events. Many of those who attend are relatives and descendants of the soldiers of the 1st Division
Strange? Where is Captain Awu? He was just here a moment ago...
With skills such as his, he should be fine, but I still worry for him.
But I've never seen that look on his face before...
Yangyang explained our arrival after we defeated enemies.
The workbook says that the cabling of each sector is connected from the power supply to the Fission Cannon.
If you get lost, you can find your way by observing the cables along the poles.
Yes, that's right, the tower-like structure.

The engineers have repaired most of the Fission Cannon's structure, but there are still several nodes of the interior power supply lines that's not been connected yet. All of which are located within the Incineranur, so it is very difficult to repair under those conditions.
Yes, that's right! I'll have them send over the diagrams and workbook right away!
In order to repair the cable lines, the Ministry's engineers have been frequently going in and out of the Incineranur.
They may inevitably step on some orchids, even with the Protection Devices, many people still got burned.
If it weren't for these flowers stopping that bike monster from coming out, I would've taken it out by now, hmph!
Hey, did you know? The Incineranur is actually a giant crater.
Yup! It's from the Fission Cannon! How about we take another shot!
Even if the main structure of the Fission Cannon can be repaired this time, I don't suppose it can release the same level of energy back in the day.
That's fine! I'm ok with it as long as it can break that barrier!
We should go look for him.
Restrict area. The flowers are to be dealt with extreme cautions. Please use the protection device as instructed. You can contact Morn Guards for more help.
Who goes there!
Yanyang, Vanguard Battalion, Midnight Rangers.
You must be Yanming? Commander Jiyan instructed us to come collect the Protection Devices.
Rover... Who is this person?
This is Rover, we have an assignment together in the Forsaken Home.
The Commander really sent you?
Identifications and permits for assignments, give me those.
Here, you mean these, correct?
Hmm... The Commander's e-signature.
No need. I... I am Yanming.
Anything else you need?
Didn't mean to make it difficult for you. I was ambushed and lost some of my things.
I don't suppose you lost the devices?
Yes, the Protection Devices.
Are you hurt? Did you report the incident?
Just a flesh wound, was about to report until you came.
I was on patrol, someone knocked me out from behind, didn't get to see who it was. It was just like in the novels!
Can you tell us what happened?
Tch... My head.
Oh no, you... This isn't some small injury, you should get yourself checked up.
It's nothing, I... Worry about the campsite.
Do you mean the research site for the Protection Devices?
At current state we have to go to the campsite to retrieve the devices, and also take the opportunity to verify its situation.
Then... I'll leave it to you, Yangyang.
If they're after the device... Camp is also in danger, we should contact them.
Agree, please wait.
You mean that?
We should go help.
We're now finally able to get a sense of how difficult it is to enter the Incineranur to repair the cable lines.
The good thing is that there isn't much left and we'll be able to activate the cannon very soon.
It's truly impressive how the 1st Division managed to complete such complicated cabling in the past.
Ugh... The same goes to you, I'm no good with all these cables.
Reports from the Ministry confirms that all cables have been repaired.
Yes, thanks to Rover's help.
Outstanding work. I'll provide you the authorizations to the Fission Cannon remotely.
Keep in mind that breaking the barrier will create a shockwave, requiring all personnel to retreat to a safe position. That includes you.
The exact coordinates have been transmitted to your terminals. Time is of the essence!
Understood! We're on our way.
Protection Devices, huh? Hmm... You Rangers probably already know, the Ministry's been busy as bees recently trying to get that cannon working again.
Demands for those devices was so high that the campsite had reserves all set aside for them.
On top of that attack just now, everything's a mess. We have to check our inventory first, you two sure picked a perfect time coming here all of a sudden...
I understand your difficulties, everyone is here for the same goal.
How about you share with us your current situation? Maybe we could be of some help.

I guess I do need to tell it to you Rangers. Those hooligans tried to rob the Protection Devices, broke into the campsite and triggered the security system, caused the door to the R&D level lock itself tight, so they intended to use force to get us to open it.
The terminal can't get a reading on their identities, but judging from their weapons, they should be Resonators.
I'll inform my superior of the situation right away.
But we're on a very important mission in need of these devices, here is the permit issued by Commander Jiyan.
Hey, don't get me wrong, it's not that I don't trust you.
Normally it wouldn't be a problem, but after what just happened, we need to ensure the security of the perimeter to unlock the security system. It's the rules.
I understand your concerns, permission to take part in the inspection on behalf of the Rangers?
My identifications have been passed on to you. If anything goes wrong, I will take full responsibilities.
If you put it that way... Sure, lemme put these down first.
The name's Dawei. When you go in, head to the furthest room and type in this name, take my spare device with you.
I've got sturdy physique with strong immunity, always use up these devices slower than others, so I have a couple of them saved up..
What about you?
I was thinking of saving them for emergencies, but you Rangers need it more than I do now, just take it.
Your generosity is much appreciated!
Just like you said, We're all on the same boat here!
I have the main entrance opened for you. Be careful when you go in, things were a bit hectic, there's no guarantee that someone didn't slip in.
While repairing the wire, you heard a strange sound. \nYou were ready for battle but then a friendly face pops out from the ruins.\nYangyang relexed a bit and then greets the person.
Phew, it's Captain Awu!
Little Skylark, perfect timing, come give me a hand, would ya!
Couldn't find the sensor module, so I can't get this line fixed.
No worries, that's what we're here for.
It's rare to see Commander Awu interested in repair work.
This way, we can break through that barrier quicker.
Why the hurry?
Hmph, heck yeah, I'm gonna be the first one to give that monster some pounding!
It's not that, but I just get the feeling... That I should be the one taking it down.
You have a grudge with the Rider?

The Academy analyzed the barrier before, it's a kind of protective mechanism formed through high Wutheron densities, they called it the High Strength Air Barrier, making the Inferno Rider able to resist harm from Incinero Petals during its resurrection.
Is there another way to take down this barrier?
Oh! I know! I know! It's like the shell of an egg, right?
The only means to destroy it, is by using that of left from the Threnodian War...
The Fission Cannon, correct?
That's right. Being one of the first generation Tacetite weapons, it stores formidable striking power, but it's structures and firing sequences are very complicated.
It was considered that these positions and heavy artillery pieces were abandoned after the Threnodian War. But I never thought they could still be restored for use.
It's always been the key to making breakthroughs, both now and then.
We get it! We get it! Little Skylark!
Let's go get this big thing up and running, then!
Captain, you've made it!
So, uh, we've nabbed those bandits and they're now on their way to Tiancheng.
Who? Me? Oh, never been better.
Are you alright?
Made it in the end, didn't I? Gave that Rider the final blow, huh?
This is where the 1st Division once fought. So... This is how it feels like.
Yeah, you won.
This is how it feels...
Captain Awu?
Oh, right. Aren't you two forgetting something? That Tacetite Bloom...
The flow coming from the Bloom... Is scorching even beyond that of all Incinero Petals combined!
It may be due to it being enriched with the Rider's Threnodian powers.
Rover, do take care when taking in those powers.
When arriving at the campsite in Sector 2, a group of unknown individuals can be seen about to attack Mornguards. \nYou and Yangyang engages them in order to stop them.
Strange, no sign of the Rider.
Huh? Watch out!
I was after a group of people acting sussy until I got here and lost their scent.
I figured they were up to no good, so I thought I should fix this cable line first.
An accurate interpretation.
Sorry to have kept you waiting. The debriefing took longer than I expected.
I've just arrived as well.
The Rangers did some questioning of the bandits we brought back. They claim they were there to snatch the Inferno Rider's Echo, but refuse to disclose their identities.
I suspect there is more to it...
I really can't thank you enough.
At least we've dealt with the Inferno Rider for now.

It may sound a bit selfish of me, but, if you hadn't appeared in time, until the Inferno Rider's full resurrection or either it being snatched by those bandits, there would've likely been a much greater sacrifice of life...
I'm aware that every soldier is prepared to sacrifice his or her life for the protection of Huanglong, but... The 1st Division, for so much to have perished, is just too...
Oh, what am I doing, we should feel happy after completing our mission, why am I making things sound so serious... Uh-uh, this is a no-no.
The remaining 2 targets. We should be heading... Wait, Rover! You look bad, and the surrounding flows is in chaos.
Tried contact the campsite multiple time but got no responds.
Campsite's coordinates already transferred to your terminals.
Watch out! TDs! Why are they here?
Campsites usually have Sound Dampeners installed to disperse TDs, this shouldn't have happened, could it be...
No matter the case, let's deal with these TDs first!
Oh, still here are ya?
Can't really tell, I normally enjoy hunting, but today's prey, made me feel empty after beating it.
Are you alright?
Grandpa Xuguan used to say a person's emotions can be very complex, that I'll understand it one day.
Arr... Grr... Nope! Don't get it! Ugh, I'm better off staying as a tiger.
Oh, yeah, the Rangers are having those bandits for questioning, aren't you gonna go have a look?
Yes, I was just about to go.
Anyone? Help!
Finally, my savior...
I tried to analyze this chip, but most of its content needs permissions.
It seems we need the Censoring Modulation to open the door... we can scan the nearby area to see if we can find it.
Inside the Incineranur, just got better and better.
Stop them! We cannot let them through before Boss got the device!
What happened?
I'm He from the Sector 2 Campsite. I was in charge of the logistics and was about to back to the camp.
Then I ran into a group of strange people and they asked me to take them to the Protection Device.
I don't like the look of them, so I refused.
You did the right thing.
But then they get angry and took my terminal, forced me to give them the location, I...
Don't worry, it's not your fault.
I cannot contact the camp without my terminal. Could you help?
Sorry, we lost the contact to the camp as well, that's why we're here.
What? Is everything in the camp alright?
Don't worry, we'll be there soon. You should find some shelter, I will have someone to pick you up.
Thank you.
I need to talk to Feiniao about changing my position again. This job is too dangerous for me. I could've died back there.
Don't get me wrong, I didn't give away any secrets.
I didn't mean it.
You're just too deliberated.
Fine, I got scared so I just gave them my terminal. I was planing to get help after they left.
And it turns out just fine. You're the help I needed.
You did nothing wrong. Saving yourself is a wise choice.
We should be leaving, take care of yourself.
You pick the wrong enemy, retreat now!
Some info of it got me worried.
What info?
There's info about the Inferno Rider, and Threnodian resurrection. It even got the Incineranur investigation record.
I just don't like the feeling seeing them so eager to get the protection device.
Yes, I saw them causing troubles in Huanglong.
You think they will get in our way?
They should be responsible for the Sound Dampeners sabotaged in Sector 1 Campsite.
I assume they plan to take advantage to rob the device, but Awu defeated them.
Anyway, we should be careful. Let's get to the campsite first.
Protection Device can only slow down the Incinero Petal damage. Step on it directly could still cause other effect, we must be cautious.
Not only the Inferno Rider. Academy just inform me some changes of the Incineranur.
Incinero Petal's effect was weakened, like... someone just soothed their rage.
Changes?
The Academy is still analyzing what's causing this. I think the First Legion has acknowledged us... you and Awu to be precise.
So... Remnant of the First Legion went dormant. At least they could rest now.
Is that so?
It must be!
You feel nothing? We were just fine when we're in contact... No, you cannot go any further.
I promised Jiyan, we need to report in if anything goes south.
Let's stop here and reach out to him.
They dropped this, a data chip.
No anomalies in the surrounding flow, the individual was highly skilled. Who could it be...?
This place is too difficult to carry on the construction work. One day's progress can not catch up with half day's work at other places.
Yes. Apart from the Wutherons with strange densities, the humidity alone is so unfriendly to our devices.
If Tiancheng was built here, I don't even know when we'll complete building.
But let me remind you, this was one of the major settlements when there wasn't Tiancheng.
Oh, right, right. Some senior members of my family did mention this. It was Chenxiang who was in charge, and this place was an emergency shelter for a large number of refugees.
Chenxiang provided great leadership for both the industrial sector and the agricultural sector. He's so amazing...
I heard from my seniors at home that their dwellings then are not far from here.
Is it the former Plateau settlement?
Yeah, the whole family fled from the northwestern plains and came there.
Life was so hard in those days.
And after that, did your family move to Tiancheng?
Yes, they only lived for ten-plus years at the Plateau settlement.
Though every time when we mention those hard days spent there, the elders still sigh a lot.
That two TDs that looked like birds back then. Were they called Yuan and Yang?
I don't understand why such beautiful names are given to this kind of monsters.
Did you read any pre-Lament cultural works?
Yes I did. They said Yuan and Yang are birds of auspices. They stand for happiness and prosperity.
But those two TDs, they only brought us pains and calamities...
Maybe from their viewpoint, it was human that brought pains and calamities.
For construction works at this place, don't follow standard practices, build more foundations, make it higher still.
I know, I know. I've made notes of these when we were doing the early surveys.
Though I still cannot grab the precise way to do this when I start the real works here.
Take it easy, don't hurry. Experience is only gained by accumulation.
If you can handle problems here, no other work could catch you out!
It seems a lot of people are taking leaves lately?
More and fewer people have some friends at the Mornguards. They go to the Cemetery in memory this time every year.
You know, when the TD waves offended back then, the Mornguards bore quite a mortality.
That makes sense. No matter what we should pay our tribute.
If it weren't them, Whining Aix's Mire would have really been that whining aix's territory.
Everyone ready? Repeat the guidelines for this operation.
First, investigation only at the peripheral areas, nothing in-depth.
Second, only diggings out of protection purposes. No damage to relic structures.
Third... What was it? Oh, yes. No touching of creations of unknown origins.
Fourth, immediate warning when encountering dangers. No action without permission.
Excellent. Good luck on our operation.
I've told you. Our clothing, shoes and hats are of great performances. There's nothing to worry about.
Yes, we have enough physical protection, but what about mental protection?
At this kind of wetland environment, if you step on it and get stuck, it won't be good with that sticky feeling.
Just tolerate it for a while. Does it drag you into the water?
Why not. Haven't you heard that horror story about the Plateau Ruins?
Stop scaring yourself. We deliver quick, and we return quick.
If you ever delay the delivery, I'm gonna show you what a real horror story is like.
After studying the dam, I found the water reserve technology before Lament was rather impressive.
Transport, power generation, irrigation, flood protection. It can be used in all these fields.
True. Great investment, great returns. That's the so-called effort in the contemporary, benefit in the future.
Pity it is abandoned. Where is the benefit to be seen?
Doesn't matter. Sooner or later, we will re-start water reserve projects.
A little fixing on basis of the original. Isn't this always better than starting over?
The bodies of water are interlinked, yet the temperature here is much lower than that at the harbor.
Maybe it's the effect of some plants, or a different illumination condition. It's normal some errors occur.
No. The two sets of data vary too much, those don't seem like errors.
According to the resources back at the Academy, this might be a result of the geological change of 104 A. L..
Let's find more samples for comparison and rule out the interference of irrelevant factors.
Fight the TDs with Gravity Streams. I couldn't think of a way like that.
You mean the fight that killed Mourning Aix's partner? There was no other way.
The frontline could never take the impact of the two bird TDs. We had to take the risk.
Though it was risky, it was the key move that turned the tide.
The Midnight Ranger officer that formulated this strategy must have been a great tactician.
That guy that assaulted Cortem Veritatis is virtually the enemy of the whole human civilization!
Why?
Look, if there hadn't been the assaults, how many research archives could have been preserved?
Let alone those researchers that were hunted down. They were truly the backbone of academia.
If the C. V. weren't dissolved, and these resources were to be re-organized and focused on key projects...
Sigh. If thought this way, so many years of scientific progress were lost.
Luckily, we sort of inherited part of C. V.'s legacy. The human civilization is not over yet.
The flow rate drops too fast at the estuary, it makes the stage for sand depositation.
If it isn't removed timely, the shipping would be influenced, which could be detrimental.
Don't worry. Though the dam before Lament was abandoned and not used anymore, its foundation is there.
The water flowing by here contains very limited sand. It shouldn't be much influential on the port.
Oh, that's a benefit for us late-comers by the forefathers' effort.
I recall that TDs don't have intelligence. They only imitate human.
Then how could they organize the waves and launch offensives as a whole?
There are levels to TDs. Senior ones influence junior ones.
With a strong TD like Mourning Aix leading, TDs of lower ranks would follow in the charges.
Then... will there be TD waves in the future?
Maybe, and maybe not. None of us can tell.
However, no matter how many times the TD waves offend, we will stop them.
You are not going with the ship this time, again?
No way. I've always been having the sickness for ships. I'd fall as soon as I'm on the deck.
Me too. I don't feel assured when my body isn't stable.
What a pity. Though it's a tough work on the sea, one views different scenes there.
I have saved some photos in my info board. Do you want to see it for yourself and get a feeling?
No, thank you. I fear I'd be lured to board the ship, and still suffer everything.
It is said there's a secret society that masters the technology to modify limbs...
Do you know where to find them?
Hey, what are you talking about. Those are not good people!
Besides, you have arms and legs. What else do you want?
Well, I become increasingly aware of the limits of flesh as I do more and more physical works.
To break the limits, I have to be either a Resonator, or a subject of novel technologies.
Stop there, will you? With a mind as defective as yours, you will overclock even if you become a Resonator.
Why don't you shoulder a few more cargos if you have the time for wondering?
Oh? Why are you on duty? Aren't you on leave today?
You guys are so busy at the port recently. How am I going to enjoy the leave?
Especially the batch imported from the New Federation. Everyone is there making the inventory for it.
So there's no one left but me to take their place and be on duty.
Sigh, you have a hard work.
We could only consider leaves in lieu after these few days' heavy work.
Among all the ships coming around doing trades, XXX's ships are the rarest.
Is it because they need none of Tacetite energy?
Oh, XXX. They are kind of hidden in shadow. They are always self-sufficient, and hardly open themselves.
I wish to hop on their ship and go to see them for myself.
Aren't you afraid of being eaten by that Orochi or something? You won't even return.
It won't dare! If it were to eat me, our Divinity Sui'guang would eat it!
Have you seen the port analytics for this term.
I haven't yet. What, another record trade surplus?
Impressive. How did you know?
Not so impressive. I see the cargo moving in and out every day. I can estimate that.
